Genesis: Creation, the beginning of mankind, and stories of the patriarchs and matriarchs.
Exodus: Israel’s deliverance from Egypt, covenant at Sinai, and tabernacle instructions.
Leviticus: Holiness, sacrifices, priesthood, and laws for worship and daily life.
Numbers: Wilderness journeys, censuses, rebellions, and preparation to enter the land.
Deuteronomy: Moses’s final speeches, covenant renewal, and preparation for Canaan.
Joshua: Conquest and settlement of the land; covenant renewal at Shechem.
Judges: Cycles of unfaithfulness and deliverance before the monarchy.
Ruth: Loyalty, redemption, and the lineage of David.
1 Samuel: Samuel, Saul, and the rise of David.
2 Samuel: David’s reign—triumphs, sins, and God’s promises.
1 Kings: Solomon’s reign and the kingdom’s division.
2 Kings: Decline and exiles of Israel and Judah.
1 Chronicles: Davidic history with focus on temple worship.
Ezra: Return from exile and rebuilding the temple.
Nehemiah: Rebuilding Jerusalem’s walls and community reforms.
Esther: Providence and preservation of the Jews in Persia.
Job: Suffering, divine wisdom, and the fear of the Lord.
Psalms: Prayers and songs for worship in every season.
Proverbs: Wisdom sayings for skillful, godly living.
Ecclesiastes: Life’s vapor and the call to fear God.
Song of Songs: Poetry of love, desire, and covenant fidelity.
Isaiah: Judgment and hope centered on the Holy One of Israel.
Jeremiah: Prophetic warnings, a new covenant promised.
Lamentations: Poems mourning Jerusalem’s fall; hope in God’s mercy.
Ezekiel: Visions of judgment and restoration; a new heart and temple.
Daniel: Faithful witness in exile; visions of God’s kingdom.
Hosea: Covenant love and faithlessness, judgment and restoration.
Joel: The day of the Lord and the Spirit poured out.
Jonah: Prophet, repentance, and God’s compassion for nations.
Micah: Justice, mercy, humility; hope in a coming shepherd-king.
Habakkuk: Faith amid perplexity; the righteous live by faith.
Zephaniah: Day of the Lord and purifying salvation.
Malachi: Covenant faithfulness; a messenger to prepare the way.
